panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kube Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: kube Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

    "period", "5m", "", ""

    "period", "1h", "", ""

  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="apiserver",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),

    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="apiserver",monitor="global",type="kube"})))),

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: apiserver SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The Kubernetes API server validates and configures data for the api objects which
include pods, services, and others. The API Server services REST operations
and provides the frontend to the cluster's shared state through which all other components
interact.

This SLI measures all non-health-check endpoints. Long-polling endpoints are excluded from apdex scores.



### Observability Tools

* [Kubernetes Cluster Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Kubernetes Cluster Warning Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22%0Aseverity%3D%28%22EMERGENCY%22%20OR%20%22ALERT%22%20OR%20%22CRITICAL%22%20OR%20%22ERROR%22%20OR%20%22WARNING%22%29;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [üìñ Kibana: Kubernetes Cluster Logs (Kibana) logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.jsonPayload.metadata.managedFields.manager,json.jsonPayload.message,json.jsonPayload.reason,json.jsonPayload.metadata.name,json.resource.labels.pod_name),filters:!((meta:(index:'1d7c16d0-c0fa-11ea-a0f8-0b8742fd907c',key:json.jsonPayload.metadata.managedFields.manager,params:kube,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.jsonPayload.metadata.managedFields.manager:(query:kube,type:phrase))))),index:'1d7c16d0-c0fa-11ea-a0f8-0b8742fd907c')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Kubernetes Cluster Logs (Kibana) requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=1d7c16d0-c0fa-11ea-a0f8-0b8742fd907c&_a=(filters:!((meta:(index:'1d7c16d0-c0fa-11ea-a0f8-0b8742fd907c',key:json.jsonPayload.metadata.managedFields.manager,params:kube,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.jsonPayload.metadata.managedFields.manager:(query:kube,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.timestamp,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

  )

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: cluster_scaleups SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

We rely on the GKE Cluster Autoscaler (https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/cluster-autoscaler) to
automatically scale up and scale down our Kubernetes fleets.

Each decision by the cluster autoscaler to scale up is treated as an operation, and each cluster scaleup failure is
treated as an error.



### Observability Tools

* [Kubernetes Autoscaler Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=logName%3D%22projects%2Fgitlab%2Dproduction%2Flogs%2Fcontainer%2Egoogleapis%2Ecom%252Fcluster%2Dautoscaler%2Dvisibility%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Kubernetes Autoscaler Errors](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=jsonPayload%2EresultInfo%2Eresults%2EerrorMsg%2EmessageId%3A%2A%0AlogName%3D%22projects%2Fgitlab%2Dproduction%2Flogs%2Fcontainer%2Egoogleapis%2Ecom%252Fcluster%2Dautoscaler%2Dvisibility%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 apiserver Latency - per scope

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for apiserver Latency - per scope
Estimated p95 apiserver Latency - per resources

panels.description: Attributes apdex downscoring
panels.title: Apdex attribution for apiserver Latency - per resources

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. Configured using resource requests.

This is the amount of CPU that a container should always have available,
though it can briefly utilize more. However, if a lot of pods on the same
host exceed their requested CPU the container could be throttled earlier.

This monitors utilization/allocated requests over a 1 hour period, and takes
the 99th quantile of that utilization percentage in that period.
We want the worst case to be around 80%-90% utilization,
meaning we've sized the container correctly. If utilization is much higher than that
the container could already be throttled because the host is overused, if it
is much lower, then we could be underutilizing a host.

This saturation point is only used for capacity planning.
The burst utilization of a CPU is monitored and alerted upon using the
`kube_container_cpu_limit` saturation point.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    quantile by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  0.99,
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}[1h])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        kube_pod_container_resource_requests:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", resource="cpu", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers can have a limit configured on how much CPU they can consume in
a burst. If we are at this limit, exceeding the allocated requested resources, we
should consider revisting the container's HPA configuration.

When a container is utilizing CPU resources up-to it's configured limit for
extended periods of time, this could cause it and other running containers to be
throttled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu_limit component saturation: Kube Container CPU over-utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Kube container throttling

A container will be throttled if it reaches the configured cpu limit for the
horizontal pod autoscaler. Or when other containers on the node are overutilizing
the the CPU.

To get around this, consider increasing the limit for this workload, taking
into consideration the requested resources.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    quantile by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  0.99,
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container)(
        rate(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total:labeled{container!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}[5m])
        /
        rate(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total:labeled{container!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_throttling component saturation: Kube container throttling

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
This resource measures the number of nodes per subnet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that clusters need to be rebuilt with
a larger subnet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, shard, cluster) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum(:kube_pod_info_node_count:{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}) by (env, environment, shard, cluster)
      /
      sum(
        gitlab:gcp_subnet_max_ips{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"} * on (subnet) group_right gitlab:cluster:subnet:mapping{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      ) by (env, environment, shard, cluster)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_node_ips component saturation: Node IP subnet saturation

panels.description:
disk space utilization on persistent volume claims.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, shard, cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes
      /
      kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_persistent_volume_claim_disk_space component saturation: Kube Persistent Volume Claim Space Utilisation

panels.description:
inode utilization on persistent volume claims.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, shard, persistentvolumeclaim) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_used
      /
      kubelet_volume_stats_inodes
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_persistent_volume_claim_inodes component saturation: Kube Persistent Volume Claim inode Utilisation

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in the node pool for
a service fleet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total:labeled{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_cpu component saturation: Average Node Pool CPU Utilization

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)
